description.lang: Flush 2 relays module is used for switching on or off two electrical devices (e.g. lights, fans, etc ...). The module can be controlled either through Z-Wave network or through the wall switches.The module is designed to be mounted inside a flush mounting box, hidden behind a traditional wall switch.Module measures power consumption of two electrical devices and supports connection of digital temperature sensor. It is designed to act as repeater in order to improve range and stability of Z-wave network.
Lifeline group (reserved for communication with the main controller), 1 node allowed.
basic on/off (triggered at change of the output Q1 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.
switch binary report (triggered at change of the output Q1 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.
power meter report (triggered at change of the output Q1 state) up to 16 nodes.
basic on/off (triggered at change of the output Q2 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.
switch binary report (triggered at change of the output Q2 state and reflecting its state) up to 16 nodes.
power meter report (triggered at change of the output Q2 state) up to 16 nodes.
multilevel sensor report (triggered at change of temperature sensor) up to 16 nodes.
Input 1 switch type
mono-stable switch type (push button)
bi-stable switch type

name.lang: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF

description.lang: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFFFlush 2 relays module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system.
ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

name.lang: Automatic turning off output Q1 after set time

description.lang: When relay Q1 is ON it goes automatically OFF after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive ON command regardless from where it comes (push button, associated module, controller,..).
Auto OFF disabled
1second (0,01s)32535 seconds (325,35s) Auto OFF enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter nr.15
Set value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor.
offset is 0.0 deg.C
value from 0.1 deg.C to 10.0 deg.C is added to actual measured temperature.
value from -0.1 deg.C to -10.0 deg.C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.

name.lang: Automatic turning on output Q1 after set time

description.lang: When relay Q1 is OFF it goes automatically ON after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive OFF command regardless from where it comes (push button, associated module, controller,..).
Auto ON disabled
1second (0,01s)32536 seconds (325,35s) Auto ON enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter nr.15
If digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter.
Reporting disabled
0,1 deg.C - 12.7 deg.C. - step is 0,1 deg.C

name.lang: Automatic turning off output Q2 after set time

description.lang: When relay Q2 is ON it goes automatically OFF after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive ON command regardless from where it comes (push button, associated module, controller,..).
Auto OFF disabled
1second (0,01s)32535 seconds (325,35s) Auto OFF enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter nr.15

name.lang: Automatic turning on output Q2 after set time

description.lang: When relay Q2 is OFF it goes automatically ON after time defined by this parameter. Timer is reset to zero each time the module receive OFF command regardless from where it comes (push button, associated module, controller,..).
Auto ON disabled
1second (0,01s)32536 seconds (325,35s) Auto ON enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter nr.15

name.lang: Automatic turning off / on seconds or milliseconds selection

description.lang: Automatic turning off / on seconds or milliseconds selectionNote that parameter is valid for both outputs Q1, Q2 and is the same for turning off or on.
seconds selected
milliseconds selected
Input 2 switch type
mono-stable switch type (push button)
bi-stable switch type

name.lang: Saving the state of the relays Q1 and Q2 after a power failure

description.lang: Saving the state of the relays Q1 and Q2 after a power failure
Flush 2 relays module saves its statebefore power failure (it returns to the lastposition saved before a power failure)
Flush 2 relays module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to &quot;off&quot; position.

name.lang: Power reporting in Watts on power change for Q1

description.lang: Set value means percentage, set value from 0100 = 0% - 100%.
Reporting Disabled

1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time changes for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. NOTE: if power changed is less than 1W, the report is not send (pushed), independent of percentage set.

name.lang: Power reporting in Watts on power change for Q2

description.lang: Set value means percentage, set value from 0100 = 0% - 100%
Reporting Disabled

1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power in Watts in real time changes for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%. NOTE: if power changed is less than 1W, the report is not send (pushed), independent of percentage set.

name.lang: Power reporting in Watts by time interval for Q1

description.lang: Set value means time interval (032535) in seconds, when power report is send.
Reporting Disabled
= 1 second32535 seconds. Reporting enabled, Power report is send with time interval set by entered value.

name.lang: Power reporting in Watts by time interval for Q2

description.lang: Set value means time interval (032535) in seconds, when power report is send.
Reporting Disabled
= 1 second32535 seconds. Reporting enabled, Power report is send with time interval set by entered value.
Set value means the type of the device that is connected to the Q1 output. The device type can be normally open (NO) or normally close (NC).
When system is turned off the output is 0V (NC).
When system is turned off the output is 230V (NO).
Set value means the type of the device that is connected to the Q2 output. The device type can be normally open (NO) or normally close (NC).
When system is turned off the output is 0V (NC).
When system is turned off the output is 230V (NO).
